ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned derivatives, evaluating functions, logarithms, graphing functions, and much more
I learned a lot of practical applications of calculus and realized how calculus ties into the real world.
Valuable teamwork and communication skills in addition to how to properly manage relationships with professors and classmates due to the group work.
Able to learn about functions and math differently than I was used to
Math 110 gave me an introductory understanding of calculus.
I was provided with a refresher of foundational algebra skills and an introduction to calculus concepts (e.g. limits, derivatives, differentiation, etc.)
I learned a good amount about calculus and being able to manipulate numbers in order to solve real world problems and optimize certain scenarios.
Math

Completing Math 110 during the Fall 2021 semester has renewed my knowledge of mathematics and refreshed my mental math skills.  I was introduced to derivatives, logarithms, and limits during this course.  These three were definitely the most challenging, but necessary.  Through the end of the semester group project, I learned exactly how math applies to the real world.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Loved this class the psets were sometimes very different from what we learned in class but I loved this class.

I really liked the outside workshops because I felt that they helped my understanding of the material significantly. However, the pre-class discoveries I found to be cumbersome and not helpful with learning anything before the start of class -- it just felt like an assignment that needed to be finished on top of problem sets and concept checks.
Very detailed in talking about material but course might move too slow
The course is well taught and the ULAs are extremely helpful. I would say the only weakness is the room that it was taught in was extremely large and made it tough to focus at times.
The amount of TA office hours offered to us.
could have gotten the class more involved. Felt like there was a lot of self learning. wish we were learning in a classroom instead of a lecture hall
This course can be improved by really focus on teaching people how to understand the work versus just completing it.
It was not necessarily a problem for myself, but I know a lot of my classmates struggled with the speed of this course.  I understand this is college level work.

Strengths: Bobby is a very good teacher and the TAs are very helpful. Also the material is realistic and has purpose.
Weaknesses: The workshops didnt relate to the material sometimes.
Great class

I think a weakness of the course was additional help for struggling students was not offered until a couple of weeks before the 2nd midterm.  I also think recordings of lectures would be helpful for students especially if struggling with the speed of the class or simply if in need of a quick live recap of a concept.  I also think some class time reserved for a homework problem or the introduction of a topic might be helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend because dr. Bobby was one of the best teachers who made going to math fun and it was easy to learn the material he was teaching.
Yes
I would definitely recommend this class to anyone who wants to get a very solid understanding of calculus.
Yes. Great professor that knows how to connect with students and properly teach them.
yes. it is good to get your calculus basics down and help you for further maths.
No.
I would recommend this course to a student who has taken calculus in the past and wants to retake it.  It is not the best place for complete beginners.
Yes, very good course where you will learn a lot and build a good base for math and calculus.
Yes

I would recommend this course to another student.  While doing that however I would make sure to disclose the amount of time this course demands especially if unfamiliar with mathematics or simply if math is not a strong suit.  I would also recommend Professor Bobby, but give the student a heads up that any communication with Bobby should be done at least a week in advance with in-class follow-ups.
